thread.title: Homebound travelers leaving Jakarta to celebrate Eid to hike by 3%Travelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Homebound travelers leaving Jakarta to celebrate Eid to hike by 3%Travelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Homebound travelers leaving Jakarta to celebrate Eid to hike by 3%Travelandtourworld.com
text:
Homebound travelers leaving Jakarta to celebrate Eid to hike by 3% Published on : Tuesday, July 14, 2015
The Jakarta authorities have forecast a three percent increase in the number of homebound travelers leaving the capital city to celebrate Eid al-Fitr, or locally called Idul Fitri Islamic festivities, with relatives in their hometowns.
“During this year’s Idul Fitri, expected to start Friday July 17, the flow of homebound travelers is expected to increase by three percent from that recorded in the previous year,” Edison Sianturi of Jakarta Population and Civil Registration office remarked here.
In 2014, the number was 3,616,744, and this year, it is expected to surge to 3,763,392.
“However, the number does not include those homebound travelers going by motorcycles, three-wheeled vehicles, and those using private cars or taking toll roads, as it is difficult to count them,” he said.
If they are also accounted for, then the number of homebound travelers from Jakarta could reach around 6.5 million people, he pointed out.
The Jakarta authorities have been monitoring travelers at strategic locations such as bus terminals, seaport, railway stations, and airport.
In the meantime, the transportation ministry has forecast the number of homecoming travelers across the country to increase by 1.9 percent to reach 20,002,724 from 19,618,530 recorded in 2014.
